cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Fork
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that the copy is red. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Frozen Shade
cards.text: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"There are some qualities—some incorporate things,/ That have a double life, which thus is made/ A type of twin entity which springs/ From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

cards.name: Gaea's Liege
cards.text:
As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls.
{T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.text:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.

cards.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
cards.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

cards.name: Granite Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Granite Gargoyle gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"While most overworlders fortunately don't realize this, Gargoyles can be most delicious, providing you have the appropriate tools to carve them." 
—The Underworld Cookbook, by Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar.

cards.name: Gray Ogre
cards.flavor: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, and preferred to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

cards.name: Green Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green. This effect doesn't remove Green Ward.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Guardian Angel
cards.text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Until end of turn, you may pay {1} any time you could cast an instant. If you do, prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to that creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Helm of Chatzuk
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Holy Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.
cards.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife Hurkyl.

cards.name: Hurloon Minotaur
cards.flavor: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: ". . . There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face. . ." —Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

cards.name: Island Fish Jasconius
cards.text:
Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius.
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Tower
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.
cards.flavor: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

cards.name: Jandor's Ring
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Discard the last card you drew this turn: Draw a card.

cards.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps he or she controls.

cards.name: Keldon Warlord
cards.text: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.

cards.name: Kird Ape
cards.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Kudzu
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.

cards.name: Lance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has first strike.

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

cards.name: Lifelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

cards.name: Lifetap
cards.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
cards.flavor: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Whenever the Llanowar Elves gather the fruits of their forest, they leave one plant of each type untouched, considering that nature's portion.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Magnetic Mountain
cards.text:
Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures he or she controls and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

cards.name: Mana Flare
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

cards.name: Mijae Djinn
cards.text: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

cards.name: Mind Twist
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

cards.name: Mishra's War Machine
cards.text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

cards.name: Nether Shadow
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Nettling Imp
cards.text: {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That creature attacks this turn if able. If it doesn't, destroy it at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort."
—The Book of Tal

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone. . ."
—Song of the Artificer

cards.name: Onulet
cards.text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

cards.name: Paralyze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor: "‘Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' ‘Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, ‘if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

cards.name: Plague Rats
cards.text: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Should you a Rat to madness tease 
Why ev'n a Rat may plague you. . ."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Recantation"

cards.name: Plateau
cards.text: ({T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Power Leak
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Power Surge
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controlled at the beginning of this turn.

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Reconstruction
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

cards.name: Red Elemental Blast
cards.text: Choose one — Counter target blue spell; or destroy target blue permanent.

cards.name: Red Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Resurrection
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Reverse Polarity
cards.text: You gain X life, where X is twice the damage dealt to you so far this turn by artifacts.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Roc of Kher Ridges
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: We encountered a valley topped with immense boulders and eerie rock formations. Suddenly one of these boulders toppled from its perch and sprouted gargantuan wings, casting a shadow of darkness and sending us fleeing in terror.

cards.name: Rock Hydra
cards.text:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Rocket Launcher
cards.text: {2}: Rocket Launcher deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Destroy Rocket Launcher at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only if you've controlled Rocket Launcher continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.
cards.flavor: What these devices lacked in subtlety, they made up in strength.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, the royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

cards.name: Sacrifice
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Sacrifice, sacrifice a creature.
Add to your mana pool an amount of {B} equal to the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

cards.name: Savannah
cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Scavenging Ghoul
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

cards.name: Scrubland
cards.text: ({T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only so
